string.name: city_laws
string.br: In Germany there are strict laws which every resident must abide to.These laws varies between several sectors\n
1.parking laws\nclick on this link for parking laws in ulm https://www.parken-in-ulm.de\n
2.rundfunkbeitrag\nThere is usually a fee for Radio and Television services in Germany click on this link for more info https://www.rundfunkbeitrag.de\n
3.Illegal downloading of movies in Germany\n for more info click on this link https://www.evz.de/en/consumer-topics/illegal-downloading-in-germany\n
4.Tax classes and laws\nYou can find here informations about the different tax classes in Germany https://steuerklassen.biz/ \n

5. The Finanzamt is responsible for taxed related issues .Recalaimation of taxes for the previous year is done mostly in the first Quater of the following year. https://fa-ulm.fv-bwl.de/pb/,Lde/Startseite \n

string.name: funding
string.br: In Germany these are some scholarships and funding schemes available for students \n
1.Bafög\nThis funding scheme is available to students from the European union.click for more info https://www.bafög.de\n
2.Konrad Adenauer stiftung scholarship \nThis is a scholarship scheme for international students.click for more info https://www.kas.de/who-are-we-looking-for-en-\n

3.Kofi Annan MBA scholarship for developing countries \n This is a scholarship scheme for students from develping countries.click for more info https://www.esmt.org/degree-programs/fees-and-financing/mba-scholarships\n

4.Daad scholarship for Development related post-graduate courses\n A scholarship for post graduate studies .click for more info https://www.daad.de/der-daad/unsere-aufgaben/entwicklungszusammenarbeit/foerderprogramme/hochschulen/infos/en/45192-development-related-postgraduate-courses-epos\n
5.Erasmus Mundus Scholarship for international students\n For European and non European citizens .click for more info https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/2007-2013/archiving\n
